intro: Scaevola subalpina, commonly known as the alpine fanflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers in shades of pink and white, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically narrow and gray-green, adapted to withstand harsh, high-altitude conditions. Scaevola subalpina is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun.
